annotations.description: We saw a few chances and nice plays, but the overall impression of the game is uninspiring and not hugely entertaining. It was an even match on the whole, with both sides enjoying spells in the ascendancy. The home side were defending patiently to win the ball off the opponent and launch the counter. However, the away side moved the ball around and were waiting for a gap to appear in the home side's defence.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: That's all for today as the game is over.

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: Giulio Donati (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a yellow card for infringement.

Vladlen Yurchenko (Bayer Leverkusen) received a pass inside the box and sent a dangerous shot in on goal, but keep the champagne on ice as one of the defenders stepped in and blocked the effort. It's hard to say whether the keeper would have stopped it.

annotations.label: time

Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the middle of the goal. Sergey Chernik guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Bayer Leverkusen are seeing far more of the ball now.

Nemanja Nikolic (BATE) collects a pass and strikes from about 21 metres out. It's a poor attempt which flies well over the bar.

Bayer Leverkusen slow the tempo of the game down by exchanging a combination of one or two touch passes. The opposition's players are finding it very difficult at the moment, very physically demanding to run without the ball.

Up to now the game has been rather average in terms of entertainment, with little in the way of thrilling moments. It has been a tight contest so far. The home players attempt to beat the opposition's defence using mostly counter attacks. The away team tries to prevail using combination football.

We saw a few chances and nice plays, but the overall impression of the game is uninspiring and not hugely entertaining. It was an even match on the whole, with both sides enjoying spells in the ascendancy. The home side were defending patiently to win the ball off the opponent and launch the counter. However, the away side moved the ball around and were waiting for a gap to appear in the home side's defence.
